alert.note: Alert for Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 3:43PM EDT until June 19 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL GUILFORD COUNTY... At 343 PM EDT, Heavy rain from thunderstorms has caused streams near North Buffalo Creek and South Buffalo Creek to flood. South Buffalo Creek near Holden Rd may also flood soon. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greensboro This includes the following flood prone locations... South Buffalo near Holden Rd and I-40, Horsepen Creek near Old Battleground Rd, Latham Park near North Buffalo Creek, Wendover Ave near Latham Park and North Church Street near East Cone Blvd. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
